Winter Solstice: These photos show the Bay Area during the darkest days of the year

The winter solstice on Dec. 21 — when the Northern Hemisphere is tilted away from the sun at its maximum point — sees just nine hours and 33 minutes of daylight in San Francisco. But the city still glows, if you know how to look.
